detaileddescription.para: The software bus is primarily a set of library routines that are called by other software tasks to send and receive packets. The software bus does not perform any operations autonomously, except for sending event messages if errors are detected during the transfer of packets.
As do other tasks, the SB task sends out housekeeping telemetry when requested through the 'Send Housekeeping Data' command.
Next: Operation of the SB Software Prev: Software Bus Terminology Up To: cFE Software Bus Overview
